Rooms Service¶

Rooms Service API Router¶

This module contains all API endpoints related to managing meeting rooms. It supports both public read operations and restricted administrative operations such as creating, updating, and deleting rooms.

Roles:

  • Admin: Full access (create/update/delete rooms)

  • Facility Manager: Has the same permissions as admin for room management

  • Regular User / Moderator / Auditor: Read-only access

Endpoints:

  • GET /rooms/ → List all rooms (public)

  • GET /rooms/{id} → Get a single room (public)

  • POST /rooms/ → Create a new room (admin/FM only)

  • PUT /rooms/{id} → Update an existing room (admin/FM only)

  • DELETE /rooms/{id} → Delete a room (admin/FM only)

rooms_service.routers.CurrentUser(token: str = Depends(dependency=<fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieve the currently authenticated user based on the JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Bearer token provided in the Authorization header.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

The authenticated user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If authentication fails.

rooms_service.routers.create_room(payload: ~rooms_service.schemas.RoomCreate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function CurrentUser>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Create a new meeting room.

Only administrators and facility managers are allowed to perform this action.

Parameters:

  • payload (RoomCreate) – The details of the room to be created.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user performing the request.

Returns:

The created room.

Return type:

RoomRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If a room with the same name already exists.

rooms_service.routers.delete_room(room_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function CurrentUser>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Delete a room from the system.

Only administrators and facility managers are permitted to delete rooms.

Parameters:

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room to delete.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the room does not exist.

rooms_service.routers.get_all_rooms(db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieve a list of all rooms in the system.

Returns:

All stored room records.

Return type:

list[RoomRead]

rooms_service.routers.get_room(room_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieve a single room by its ID.

Parameters:

room_id (int) – The ID of the room to retrieve.

Returns:

The room data if found.

Return type:

RoomRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the room does not exist.

rooms_service.routers.require_admin(user: User)¶

Ensure that the current user has admin privileges.

Parameters:

user (User) – The authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not an admin.

rooms_service.routers.update_room(room_id: int, payload: ~rooms_service.schemas.RoomUpdate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function CurrentUser>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Update information for an existing room.

This includes modifying capacity, equipment, location, or availability. Only administrators and facility managers can update rooms.

Parameters:

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room to update.

  • payload (RoomUpdate) – Fields to update.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated room.

Return type:

RoomRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the room does not exist.

Room Model¶

This module defines the SQLAlchemy model for meeting rooms in the Smart Meeting Room Management System. Each room entry stores general room information (name, capacity, equipment, location) as well as its availability status, which determines whether the room can be booked.

Fields:

id (int): Primary key identifier for the room. name (str): Unique room name chosen by administrators (e.g., “Conference Room A”). capacity (int): Maximum number of people the room can hold. equipment (str): Comma-separated list of available equipment

(e.g., “Projector, Whiteboard, HDMI”).

location (str): Physical location of the room (building, floor, room number). available (bool): Indicates whether the room is available for booking.

If set to False, the room is considered out-of-service.

This model is used by the Rooms Service to support all room-related CRUD operations performed by administrators and facility managers.

class rooms_service.models.Room(**kwargs)¶

SQLAlchemy model representing a meeting room.

This table stores the essential information needed to manage rooms in the system. A room can be created, updated, deleted, or marked as out-of-service by authorized roles (admin and facility manager).

id¶

Primary key.

Type:

int

name¶

Unique room name (cannot be null).

Type:

str

capacity¶

Seating capacity of the room.

Type:

int

equipment¶

Equipment list stored as text.

Type:

str

location¶

Human-readable location string.

Type:

str

available¶

Room availability status. Defaults to True.

Type:

bool

available¶
capacity¶
equipment¶
id¶
location¶
name¶

Pydantic Schemas for the Rooms Service¶

This module defines the data validation schemas used by the Rooms Service. These schemas ensure that incoming requests contain valid data and that responses returned to clients follow a consistent structure.

Schemas included:

  • RoomCreate : Used when creating a new room.

  • RoomUpdate : Used when partially updating an existing room.

  • RoomRead : Used when returning room information to the client.

class rooms_service.schemas.RoomCreate(*, name: str, capacity: int, equipment: str, location: str, available: bool = True)¶

Schema for creating a new meeting room.

Required by:

POST /rooms/

Fields:

name (str): Unique name of the room. capacity (int): Maximum number of occupants. equipment (str): Comma-separated list of available equipment. location (str): Physical location (building, floor, room number). available (bool): Whether the room is available for booking.

Defaults to True.

available: bool¶
capacity: int¶
equipment: str¶
location: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str¶
class rooms_service.schemas.RoomRead(*, id: int, name: str, capacity: int, equipment: str, location: str, available: bool)¶

Schema returned when sending room information to the client.

Used by:

GET /rooms/ GET /rooms/{room_id} POST /rooms/ PUT /rooms/{room_id}

Fields:

id (int): Unique identifier of the room. name (str): Name of the room. capacity (int): Seating capacity. equipment (str): Equipment list. location (str): Physical location of the room. available (bool): Whether the room is currently available.

available: bool¶
capacity: int¶
equipment: str¶
id: int¶
location: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str¶
class rooms_service.schemas.RoomUpdate(*, name: str | None = None, capacity: int | None = None, equipment: str | None = None, location: str | None = None, available: bool | None = None)¶

Schema for updating an existing room.

Used by:

PUT /rooms/{room_id}

All fields are optional to allow partial updates. Only fields provided by the client will be modified.

Fields:

name (str | None): New room name. capacity (int | None): Updated seating capacity. equipment (str | None): Updated equipment list. location (str | None): Updated room location. available (bool | None): Availability flag (True/False).

available: bool | None¶
capacity: int | None¶
equipment: str | None¶
location: str | None¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str | None¶
